html.text: References
This interaction presents written and interactive content.
Relevant knowledge base articles and resources appear in the References sidebar.
Click here to review earlier content.
Click here to advance to the next part of the interaction. This button becomes clickable after you finish the current part of the interaction.
Interactive controls appear here when necessary.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

Control Center gives you quick access to commonly used controls and apps. </br></br>To use Control Center, swipe up from the bottom of the screen. In Settings > Control Center, you can make Control Center inaccessible from the Lock screen or from apps.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

How do you open Control Center?

A. Swipe left from the right side of the screen.

B. Swipe right from the left side of the screen.

C. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen.

D. Swipe down from the top of the screen.
Incorrect. Try again.
Good job!

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

The icons at the top of Control Center provide quick access to commonly used settings.

Except for orientation lock, you can access the settings in Control Center from the Settings app.

When working with customers, you should use the Control Center icons whenever possible because they're faster than using the Settings app.

variable.name: slide_5_text
variable.text: Click each of the icons at the top of Control Center to learn what they do.

variable.name: airplane_text
variable.text: Airplane Mode: Turn on airplane mode to disable Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cellular connectivity.

variable.name: wifi_text
variable.text: Wi-Fi: From Control Center, you can use the Wi-Fi icon to turn Wi-Fi on and off.

variable.name: bluetooth_text
variable.text: Bluetooth: From Control Center, you can use the Bluetooth icon to turn Bluetooth on and off.

variable.name: dnd_text
variable.text: Do Not Disturb: Keep calls, alerts, and notifications from making sounds or waking the display while the screen is locked.

variable.name: portrait_text
variable.text:
Portrait Orientation Lock: Turn this on to lock your device's screen orientation.

iPhone screens do not change to landscape orientation while portrait orientation lock is on.

You can lock the orientation of iPad devices to either landscape or portrait.

html.text:
References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"
<notrans>#!slide_5_text!#</notrans>

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"
Control Center includes a brightness slider and music playback controls.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

Which Control Center setting disables Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cellular connectivity when you turn it on?

A. Airplane mode

B. Bluetooth

C. Do not disturb

D. Portrait orientation lock
Incorrect. Try again.
Good job!

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"
You manage your AirDrop availability from Control Center. </br></br>Click the AirDrop icon.

AirDrop requires an iCloud account. AirDrop works via Bluetooth and Wi-Fi between iOS devices and computers.

AirDrop works on most recent iOS devices.

Click the next button to continue.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"
Use the AirPlay icon to connect to AirPlay-enabled devices on your network. The AirPlay icon appears only if your Wi-Fi network includes an AirPlay-enabled device.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"

The icons at the bottom of Control Center have several functions: illuminate your device's LED flash for use as a flashlight, and open Clock, Calculator, and Camera.

Click the icons at the bottom of Control Center to learn what they do.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"
Flashlight activates the device's LED flash as a flashlight. This icon appears only on devices that have an LED flash.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"
The clock icon opens the Clock app.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"
The calculator icon opens the Calculator app, but only on devices that have Calculator. iOS devices that don't include Calculator don't have a Calculator icon in Control Center.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"
The camera icon opens the Camera app. You can also access Camera from the Lock screen.

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"

Elizabeth says that there is no Calculator icon in Control Center on her iPad. What should you tell her?

A. "Because iPad doesn't have Calculator, there isn't supposed to be a calculator icon in Control Center."

B. "You need to install a third-party calculator app on your iPad."

C. "Ensure that Calculator is enabled in Settings > Control Center."

D. "Restore your iPad to replace the missing icon."
Incorrect. Try again.
Good job!

References

"Use Control Center on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch"

"Use AirPlay to wirelessly stream content from your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch"
You completed this interaction.
